Instead of abolishing the penalty altogether, solutions could include using all-volunteer execution squads. If some prison workers 'conscientiously object' to taking part in executions, they can be given other jobs. For those willing to do the task, special consideration can be given, such as extra time off in order to decompress after an execution.
